intro: Silene cucubalus var. bosniaca, commonly known as the Bosnian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Silene cucubalus var. bosniaca is often found in open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
